text.__SUMMARY__: Pultenaea pauciflora   (Narrogin pea) is a pea which is endemic to Western Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family. There are no synonyms.The species was first formally described by botanist Munro Briggs Scott in 1914. The specific epithet, pauciflora, is derived from the Latin words, paucus (pauci-), meaning "few", and flos (floris) meaning "flower" to give a compound Botanical Latin adjective which describes this Pultenaea as "few-flowered" or as "having few flowers".
